column1: #Text=This is the implement of the ICLR2022 paper "[OntoProtein: Protein Pretraining With Ontology Embedding](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2201.11147.pdf)".
#Text=OntoProtein is an effective method that make use of structure in GO (Gene Ontology) into text-enhanced protein pre-training model.
#Text=- ❗NOTE: We provide a NLP for science paper-list at [https://github.com/zjunlp/NLP4Science_Papers](https://github.com/zjunlp/NLP4Science_Papers).

#Text=In this work we present OntoProtein, a knowledge-enhanced protein language model that jointly optimize the KE and MLM objectives, which bring excellent improvements to a wide range of protein tasks.
#Text=And we introduce **ProteinKG25**, a new large-scale KG dataset, promting the research on protein language pre-training.
#Text=To run our code, please install dependency packages for related steps.
#Text=For extracting the definition of the GO term, we motified the code in `goatools` library.
#Text=Specially, in library `tape_proteins`, it only implements the calculation of metric `P@L` for the contact prediction task.
#Text=So, for reporting the metrics P@K taking different K values, in which the metrics P@K are precisions for the top K contacts, we made some changes in the library.
#Text=**Note:** environments configurations of some baseline models or methods in our experiments, e.g.
#Text=BLAST, DeepGraphGO, we provide related links to configurate as follows:
#Text=For pretraining OntoProtein, fine-tuning on protein-related tasks and inference, we provide acquirement approach of related data.

#Text=To incorporate Gene Ontology knowledge into language models and train OntoProtein, we construct [ProteinKG25](https://zjunlp.github.io/project/ProteinKG25/), a large-scale KG dataset with aligned descriptions and protein sequences respectively to GO terms and protein entities.
#Text=There have two approach to acquire the pre-training data: 1) download our prepared data **ProteinKG25**, 2) generate your own pre-training data.
#Text=We have released our prepared data **ProteinKG25** in [Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1iTC2-zbvYZCDhWM_wxRufCvV6vvPk8HR/view).
#Text=The whole compressed package includes following files:
#Text=- `go_def.txt`: GO term definition, which is text data.
#Text=We concatenate GO term name and corresponding definition by colon.
#Text=- `go_type.txt`: The ontology type which the specific GO term belong to.
#Text=The index is correponding to GO ID in `go2id.txt` file.
#Text=- `go2id.txt`: The ID mapping of GO terms.
#Text=The triplet data constitutes the interior structure of Gene Ontology.
#Text=The data format is < `h r t`>, where `h` and `t` are respectively head entity and tail entity, both GO term nodes.
#Text=`r` is relation between two GO terms, e.g.
#Text=The whole protein sequence data are used as inputs in MLM module and protein representations in KE module.
#Text=The triplet data constitutes the exterior structure of Gene Ontology, i.e.
#Text=The data format is <`h r t`>, where `h` and `t` are respectively head entity and tail entity.

#Text=It is different from GO-GO triplet that a triplet in Protein-GO triplet means a specific gene annotation, where the head entity is a specific protein and tail entity is the corresponding GO term, e.g. protein binding function.
#Text=`r` is relation between the protein and GO term.
#Text=We mix relations in two triplet relation.
#Text=For generating your own pre-training data, you need download following raw data:
#Text=- `go.obo`: the structure data of Gene Ontology.
#Text=The download link and detailed format see in [Gene Ontology](http://geneontology.org/docs/download-ontology/)`
#Text=When download these raw data, you can excute following script to generate pre-training data:
#Text=Our experiments involved with several protein-related downstream tasks.
#Text=You can pre-training your own OntoProtein based above pretraining dataset.

#Text=Before pretraining OntoProtein, you need to download two pretrained model, respectively [ProtBERT](https://huggingface.co/Rostlab/prot_bert) and [PubMedBERT](https://huggingface.co/microsoft/BiomedNLP-PubMedBERT-base-uncased-abstract-fulltext) and save them in `data/model_data/ProtBERT` and `data/model_data/PubMedBERT`.
#Text=We provide the script `bash script/run_pretrain.sh` to run pre-training.
#Text=And the detailed arguments are all listed in `src/training_args.py`, you can set pre-training hyperparameters to your  need.
#Text=We have released the checkpoint of pretrained model on the model library of `Hugging Face`.
#Text=The shell files of training and evaluation for every task are provided in `script/` , and could directly run.
#Text=Also, you can utilize the running codes `run_downstream.py` , and write your shell files according to your need:
#Text=- `run_downstream.py`: support `{ss3, ss8, contact, remote_homology, fluorescence, stability}` tasks;
#Text=Running shell files: `bash script/run_{task}.sh`, and the contents of shell files are as follow:
#Text=Arguments for the training and evalution script are as follows,
#Text=- `--task_name`: Specify which task to evaluate on, and now the script supports `{ss3, ss8, contact, remote_homology, fluorescence, stability}` tasks;
#Text=- `--model`: The name or path of a protein pre-trained checkpoint.
#Text=- `--output_file`: The path of the fine-tuned checkpoint saved.
#Text=- `--do_train`: Specify if you want to finetune the pretrained model on downstream tasks.
#Text=- `--gradient_accumulation_steps`: The number of gradient accumulation steps.
#Text=- `--warmup_ratio`: Ratio of total training steps used for a linear warmup from 0 to `learning_rate`.
#Text=- `--frozen_bert`: Specify if you want to frozen the encoder in the pretrained model.
#Text=Additionally, you can set more detailed parameters in `run_main.sh`.
#Text=**Notice: the best checkpoint is saved in** `OUTPUT_DIR/`.
#Text=title={OntoProtein: Protein Pretraining With Gene Ontology Embedding},
#Text=author={Ningyu Zhang and Zhen Bi and Xiaozhuan Liang and Siyuan Cheng and Haosen Hong and Shumin Deng and Qiang Zhang and Jiazhang Lian and Huajun Chen},
